Description: Fragment of rim and bowl of North Ionian pottery plate or standed bowl. Cream slip. Underside: rays at centre and multiple banding on rest; bars on outside of lip; on top of lip band of maeander and crossed boxes bewteen bands; at outside of floor band of stopt maeander between broad bands with traces of added colour; to the centre, black-figure lion to left, with added red; rosette and pendant semi-rosette fill.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.927)
